The correct chronological order of events is: 
1. A siren and car horn play as a FedEx-lit truck crosses a bridge at night and a welcome to the channel is heard. This event sets the scene and atmosphere for the rest of the video.
2. The host, in a gray “CAMP ROCKIN’ RV” shirt, says his wife isn't present this NASCAR weekend while standing by a stickered white RV. This provides context about the setting and environment for the rest of the video.
3. At a checkpoint, two staff in high-visibility vests answer which side to scan a ticket as a man in orange approaches. This event represents a typical aspect of attending a race or camping event.
4. Upbeat rock music plays while driving past desert mountains and a “Mobil 1” truck toward a parking sign with a red P and arrows. This event creates an exciting and energetic mood for the rest of the video.
5. Over sunset RV park shots, narration says camping is fun and you can make new friends, with mellow electronic synths. This event emphasizes the positive aspects of camping and socializing.
6. Race commentary introduces a championship; engines scream; a crash happens; on-screen text names Daniel Hemric the winner. This

The correct chronological order of events is: 1) The host invites comments with a "LEAVE A COMMENT" graphic appearing on screen. 2) As rock music plays, a vehicle passes a Mobil 1 truck and heads towards a red P parking sign. 3) A conversation at a checkpoint clarifies which side to scan a ticket while a man in orange approaches two high-visibility staff. 4) On-screen text reads "Driving to our site" as the vehicle proceeds past rows of RVs and American flags. 5) At sunset in the RV park, narration says camping at NASCAR is fun and you can make new friends over mellow electronic music. 6) Near string-lit camps and the "WELCOMING PHOENIX RACEWAY GATE 3" sign, a speaker thanks viewers and asks to subscribe and like. 7) During the night race, commentary sets up the championship; engines roar; a crash ensues; then text declares Daniel Hemric the winner.

Therefore, the answer is C: 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 3 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7.
